electrmgntc_spectrm.name: The Electromagnetic Spectrum: Analytical
enduring_understandings: The electromagnetic spectrum contains seven types of electromagnetic waves, including visible light.
While all waves are experienced and applied in qualitatively different waves, they are all the same thing: oscillating electric and magnetic energy.
The only true differences amongst electromagnetic waves are quantitative values: wavelength, frequency, and photon energy
These three values are related by fundamental constants.
Frequency and energy are directly proportional, while wavelength is inversely proportional to both.

heat_formula_1.objective: Determine the heat energy necessary to cause a temperature change.

thermal_contact_1.name: Thermal Contact 1: Zeroth Law of Thermodynamics
thermal_contact_1.objective: Recognize (multiple choice) how heat will move when two objects are in thermal contact; determine when such a process ends.

heat_formula_2.name: Heat Formula 2
heat_formula_2.objective: Solve the heat formula for mass or specific heat; determine what a material is based on specific heat.

heat_graphs.name: Heat Graphs
heat_graphs.objective: Draw qualitative graphs of temperature as heat is added; describe and explain what happens when state changes in these graphs.

thermal_contact_2.name: Thermal Contact 2
thermal_contact_2.objective: Determine how heat will move when two objects are in thermal contact; determine when such a process ends.

heat_formula_multi_step.name: Heat Formula Multi_Step
heat_formula_multi_step.objective: Determine the amount of heat necessary to both ehat an object and change the state of matter of that object.

heat_formula_3.name: Heat Formual 3
heat_formula_3.objective: Solve heat formula problems asking for final or initial temperature.

newtons_law_of_cooling.name: Newton's Law of Cooling
newtons_law_of_cooling.objective: Model the temperature of a cooling object as an exponential decay and connect this to the zeroeth law of thermodynamics.

heat_formula_multistep_2.name: Heat Formula Multistep 2
heat_formula_multistep_2.objective: Solve a problem using the heat formula in which an object changes state of matter and you must determine final or initial temperature.

heat_formula_mixture.name: Heat Formula Mixtures
heat_formula_mixture.objective: Determine the final temperature of a mixture; determine the heat capacity of an unknown substance by placing it in water.

heat_processes.name: Heat Processes
heat_processes.idea: This unit will deal with heat processes on P-V graphs.

counting_parts_of_a_nucleus.name: Counting Parts of a Nucleus
counting_parts_of_a_nucleus.objective: Count the protons and neutrons in a nucleus; represent a nucleus in nuclide notation

atomic_mass_v_mass_number.name: Atomic Mass vs. Mass Number
atomic_mass_v_mass_number.objective: Differentiate between atomic mass and mass number; explain when each is useful

alpha_and_beta_decay.name: Alpha and Beta Decay
alpha_and_beta_decay.objective: Draw reactions involving alpha or beta decay of an isotope.

complete_nuclear_reaction.name: Complete a Nuclear Reaction
complete_nuclear_reaction.objective: Complete a nuclear reaction formula that has missing information; identify the reaction as fission, fuision, or decay.

simple_half_life.name: Simple Half Life
simple_half_life.limits: Problems in this seciton do not require the half-life to be represented as a function.
simple_half_life.example: If an isotope has a half-life of 3 years and you have 32 grams of the isotope, how much mass will you have after 9 years?

identify_crucial_particles.name: Identify Crucial Particles
identify_crucial_particles.objective: Identify the particles most crucial to understanding nuclear reactions.

written_description_of_reactions_1.name: Written Reactions 1
written_description_of_reactions_1.objective: For a written description of a nuclear reaction, write the reaction in a proper formula.
written_description_of_reactions_1.example: uranium-238 undergoes alpha decay, write the reaction; a hydrogen atom and an alpha particle fuse, write the reaction

written_description_of_reactions_2.name: Written Reactions 2
written_description_of_reactions_2.objective: For a written description of a nuclear reaction, write the reaction in a proper formula; determine energy released by a nuclear reaction.
written_description_of_reactions_2.notes: This crucial topic should be broken into two sections

half_life_formulas.name: Half-Life Formulas
half_life_formulas.objective: Represent half-life through an exponential decay function; use these formulas properly

calculate_atomic_mass.name: Calculate Atomic Mass
calculate_atomic_mass.objective: Calculate the atomic mass of an element from a weighted average of isotopes and explain the purpose of this calculation.

decay_chain.name: Decay Chain
decay_chain.objective: Use a table of isotopes to draft a decay chain for a particular isotope.

nuclear_reactions_in_sun.name: Nuclear Reactions in the Sun
nuclear_reactions_in_sun.objective: Write and analyze the nuclear reactions occuring inside the sun; explain how they produce energy.

decay_chain_and_half_life.name: Remnants of an Isotope
decay_chain_and_half_life.objective: Based upon the decay chain and the half-life of a particular isotope, identify at particualr times what different products you will have and what radiation they will give off.
decay_chain_and_half_life.notes: Good lead-in to a computation problem.

nuclear_reaction_basic_concepts.name: Nuclear Reaction Basic Concepts
nuclear_reaction_basic_concepts.objective: Identify parts of an atom; know that nuclear reactions occur only in the nucleus of the atom; define terms 'radioactive' and 'radioactivity

fission_fuision_and_decay.name: Fission, Fuision, and Decay
fission_fuision_and_decay.objective: Differentiate between three types of nuclear reactions: fission, fuision, and decay

nuclear_v_chemical_reactions.name: Nuclear vs. Chemical Reactions
nuclear_v_chemical_reactions.objective: Differentiate between nuclear and chemical reactions

nuclear_reaction_danger.name: Nuclear Reaction Danger
nuclear_reaction_danger.objective: Assess the danger of different types of nuclear reactions
nuclear_reaction_danger.notes: Requires previous knowledge of the electromagnetic spectrum.

nuclear_reactions_in_stars.name: Nuclear Reaction Stars
nuclear_reactions_in_stars.objective: Explain the processes of stars by using the concept of nuclear reaction.

artificially_created_elements_1.name: Artificially Created Elements 1
artificially_created_elements_1.objective: Explain how new elements can be artificially created; draw reactions that go with those examples.

artificially_created_elements_2.name: Artificially Created Elements 2
artificially_created_elements_2.objective: Explain more complex examples of how new elements can be artificially created; draw reactions that go with those examples.

isotopes_of_uranium.name: Isotopes of Uranium
isotopes_of_uranium.objective: Explain the importance of different isotopes of uranium for the creation of a nuclear reactor or a nuclear bomb; examine how different isotopes are isolated.

periodic_table_cosmology.name: Periodic Table Cosmology
periodic_table_cosmology.objective: Explain, using descriptions of reactions, how heavier elements within the universe can be created.

energy_levels.name: Energy Levels
energy_levels.objective: Determine the difference between different energy levels of an atom.

photons_and_atoms.name: Photons and Atoms
photons_and_atoms.objective: Explain how and why photons of a precise energy can be emitted or absorbed by an atom, refer to electrons and energy levels in your answer

energy_levels_and_photons.name: Energy Levels and Photons
energy_levels_and_photons.objective: Given an atom of various energy levels, determine the wavelength, frequency, and color or type of wave that can be emitted by that atom.

ionizing_radiation.name: Ionizing Radiation
ionizing_radiation.objective: Differentiate between ionizing and non-ionizing radiation

cell_phone_controversy.name: Cell Phone Controversy
cell_phone_controversy.objective: Evaluate the danger of devices that emit electromagnetic waves such as cellphones; defend choices using knowledge of atomic structure and electromagnetic waves.

bands_in_spectrum.name: Bands in Spectrum
bands_in_spectrum.objective: Given a spectrum showing bands of particualr wavelengths, recognize the bands by consutling a table of energy levels.

neon_lights.name: Neon Lights
neon_lights.objective: Use the chemical composition of a neon tube to determine what color a neon light will shine.

astrochemistry.name: Astrochemistry
astrochemistry.objective: Determine the chemical composition of an astronomical body using a spectrum of taht body and a table of energy levels between atoms; defend choices.

quantum_theory_basics.name: Basic Quantum Theory
quantum_theory_basics.notes: A brief introduction to some concepts that would be covered in a college quantum mechanics course, but not including solutions to the Schrodinger equation.

recognize_energy_types.name: Recognize Energy Types
recognize_energy_types.objective: Recognize (multiple choice) single examples of different types of energy

write_energy_types.name: Write Energy Types
write_energy_types.objective: Write the names of different types of energy.

state_law_of_conservation_of_energy.name: State the Law of Conservation of Energy
state_law_of_conservation_of_energy.objective: State, from memory, the law of conservation of energy.

recognize_energy_transfer.name: Recognize Energy Transfer
recognize_energy_transfer.objective: Recognize (multiple choice) processes of 2-3 steps in which energy changes from one type to another; name these processes

describe_energy_transfer_1.name: Describe Energy Transfer 1
describe_energy_transfer_1.objective: Write, using tables as guidance, processes of 2 - 3 steps in which energy changes from one type to another; name these processes.

describe_energy_transfer_2.name: Describe Energy Transfer 2
describe_energy_transfer_2.objective: Write without guidance energy transfer in four or more steps; name processes involved.
describe_energy_transfer_2.example: Describe how the energy contained in natural gas is converted to light energy from a light bulb.

connect_energy_to_sun.name: Connect Energy to Sun
connect_energy_to_sun.objective: Connect (nearly) all forms of energy on earth back to light from the sun.
connect_energy_to_sun.notes: The exceptions, which should be noted, are geothermal and nuclear energy.

connect_energy_to_dust.name: Connect Energy to Dust
connect_energy_to_dust.objective: Connect energy of the earth back to the gravitational potential energy of space dust (which would eventually form the sun)
connect_energy_to_dust.connections: Requires knowledge of gravitation and nuclear physics
